cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: near the extreme southwest Florida peninsula, about 55 miles SE of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico this weekend, then turning northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS region) by late Monday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only from Ochlockonee River to Okaloosa/Walton County Line in the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West and central coast of Florida, Florida Panhandle, Alabama, Mississippi and eastern Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts to tropical-storm force (39-45 mph) possible Saturday while system pulls away
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches with localized 6 inches; risk of scattered flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado possible in outer rain bands over southern Florida
